H0.text: Kinetic energy is the type of energy measured by the 215‑calorie unit on the cereal box that a student reads when checking the nutritional information.

H1.text: Chemical energy is the type of energy measured by the unit of calories when a student reads that a single serving of cereal contains 215 calories.

H2.text: Electrical is the type of energy being measured by the unit of calories in a single serving of cereal that contains 215 calories.

H3.text: Mechanical energy is the type of energy measured by the unit calories, as indicated by the single serving of cereal containing 215 calories that a student reads on the box.

A6.text: The daily 1,600–3,000 calories (7–13 MJ) recommended for a human adult are taken as food molecules, mostly carbohydrates and fats.

A7.text: Other energy units such as the electronvolt, food calorie, thermodynamic kilocalorie and BTU are used in specific areas of science and commerce.
